page.title: 06CHANGING TIMES
page.content: There are many more people living in the area now, and many more cars. Public transport and shopping facilities are much improved. A number of supermarkets have been built - Co-op, Morrisons, Liptons plus many other smaller shops. Although most of the residents interviewed welcome the better shopping and transport facilities, and the modernised property, a number of them feel that there is too much litter now, and that vandalism is a serious problem - particularly graffiti on walls. Also, one of the residents interviewed feels that there is no community spirit like there used to be, and that people in the area were friendlier in the past than they are now.
